reviewText: Another very good Basil Dearden movie of the 60's. If you don't know Gina Lollobrigida, this crime story will make you understand why she was considered as Sophia Loren's challenger in terms of Italian sex-appeal. Ralph Richardson is despicable as an infirm millionaire and Sean Connery shot the film between two James Bonds. Highly recommended.

reviewText: I taped this movie from TV years ago.  I still enjoy seeing it.  It would be nice if it were on DVD.  This stars Sean Connery, Gina Lollabrigida, and Ralph Richardson at a younger time.  It is interesting how the story line plays out.I  will not spoil it by telling.  I would love to have it on DVD.  I still have my tape from years before.  The story shows how things can change from how they started.  It is worth the watch.

reviewText: This is an excellent film. Sean Connnery and Tina Lollobrigida are well cast,  act well and it's also pleasant on the eye  seeing the two of them together. I loved the twists in the plot and the ending was very satisfying. I appreciated its clear anti-racist mssage at one stage. , seeing it was made in 1964.It's a shame a film of this calibre is not available on Dvd.

reviewText: Woman of Straw is one of those movies from my youth (like Back Street with John Gavin) that I love but is practically impossible to rent and/or buy.  To stumble upon Woman of Straw on Amazon today AND for free because of my Prime Membership...pinch me because I must be dreaming.Forget the lame title of this movie and just watch it!  The plot is very Alfred Hitchcock-ish and Sean Connery is excellent.Thank you Amazon Prime.  I'll watch this one again.
summary: A Must See for Any Hitchcock and/or Connery Fan

reviewText: I began to watch this for the stars playing the leading roles. It held my interest for a little while, but it was just too predictale. Poor woman makes deal with unscrupulous man, then actually loves the man she's conniving against, he dies, she's accused but innocent. I can't spoil the ending because I didn't watch it - maybe there was a surprise, but I couldn't work up enough interest to care.

reviewText: Basil Dearden was one the most prominent British filmmakers of the Forties and Fifties; and in this movie you will understand why.The first third of the picture is a hidden homage to Hamlet. All the analogies are there. This brilliant introduction will become the big frame for a meticulous, cold and analytical plan where the untiring greed, hate in the search of a dark justice will allow to build an intelligent thriller of high caliber tension.Ralph Richardson is superb in his role as well as a young Sean Connery and the Italian Goddess Gina Lollobrigida.A must-see and acquire.

reviewText: I saw this movie when I was sixteen. It blew me away and then I had to read the book. The book gives more detail but the story is the same. Very suspenseful! It has scenes in it that you will remember all your life.

reviewText: WOMAN OF STRAW is no doubt seen with curiosity by Sean Connery's fans, but the real interest here lies in Ralph Richardson and Gina Lollobrigida.  It is a joy to see them together.  Such an unlikely pair, and how poignant and beautiful they are because of it.  Both actors are in excellent shape; Lollobrigida as beautiful as ever.  A good film, well directed, with great production values.  Why not digitally transfer to DVD, with a few extras?
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Tom Hockman "Big Audible fan since 2007. Love...
reviewText: I had heard of this movie for years, but never had a chance to see it until now on Netflix. Besides the good performances by Ralph Richardson and Gina Lollobrigida, Connery dominates the movie looking and often acting like James Bond. That's not a dig, but rather an observation that Connery's character overlaps with Bond in many ways: fancy, tailored suits and tuxedos, similar treatment of women, affinity for fine food and locations, driving expensive sports cars, and delivering lines with that baritone voice. The villain angle gives Connery something to play differently than Bond, and it's one of his better performances outside of Bond.This movie must have been filmed in between "From Russia with Love" and "Marnie". Connery never looked better than the period between '62 and '65. As you watch him in this movie, it's stunning to compare how much he aged by 1971 in "Diamonds are Forever" just seven years later. It's a pleasure watching Connery in his prime.As for this movie, itself, it's a pretty good thriller. It moves slowly by today's standards, but if you keep the timeframe it was made in mind, it's not a bad way to spend two hours. The locations are beautiful and the classical score stands up over time, since it's, well, classical.  I was surprised how good it is despite being absent from cable and video for so many years. Why has this movie been so obscure?
summary: A great thriller, and a Bond bonus
Title: N/A
